programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: BBC One joins the BBC's rolling news channel for a night of news.

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: The latest news, sport, business and weather from the BBC's Breakfast team.

programme.title: Morning Live S5
programme.desc: Conversation, advice and great company to make your morning.

programme.title: Rip Off Britain
programme.desc: The team explore the online reviews that may not be all they appear to be, and share the very latest advice on how to spot the real from the fake so that you can buy with confidence. Also, we reveal the handy document you must take on your holidays. Simon Calder is back, sharing bags of travel tips, advice and insights. And from greenwashing to counterfeit books, the Advice Clinic team tackles more of your problems head on.

programme.title: Fraud Squad S3 (n°5)
programme.desc: A conwoman brazenly steals £1 million from the public purse to fund her lavish lifestyle.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer S25 (61/80)
programme.desc: Featuring properties in Lancashire, Nottinghamshire and South Yorkshire.

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: The market town of Leominster is the destination for today's show. Guiding the teams around an antiques centre in the Herefordshire town are Kate Bliss and Philip Serrell, but which team will make the biggest profit or the smallest loss at auction? Eric talks to a local author about the rescued photographs of a local farmer.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international news from the BBC.

programme.title: Father Brown (The Menace of Mephistopheles) S9 (1/10)
programme.desc: «The Menace of Mephistopheles»Goodfellow turns to Father Brown when he witnesses Mallory frame an innocent man.

programme.title: Money for Nothing S8 (6/15)
programme.desc: Jay Blades finds two record players and a pair of stools to work on and turn a profit.

programme.title: Escape to the Country S23 (5/55)
programme.desc: Sonali Shah helps a young couple swap town life in Halifax for country life in Yorkshire.

programme.title: Garden Rescue S8
programme.desc: Debra from Wigan wants her new build plot to be transformed into a calming zen garden for relaxation and contemplation. She'd also like it to be low maintenance and maximise the views from the woodland beyond. For £6,000, can Charlie and Lee bring her vision to life?

programme.title: Clean It, Fix It S2 (5/20)
programme.desc: The team organise costume designer Ploy's home.

programme.title: Pointless S29
programme.desc: The brainy quiz returns, but this time host Alexander Armstrong is joined by co-host Ria Lina. As always, contestants try to score as few points as possible by plumbing the depths of their general knowledge to come up with the answers no-one else could think of.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international news from the BBC.

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Roman Kemp bring you the stories that matter from across the country.

programme.title: Our Lives (My Husband the MMA Fighter) S7 (n°1)
programme.desc: «My Husband the MMA Fighter»Stevie "Braveheart" Ray's million dollar cage fight, told through his wife Natalie's eyes.

programme.title: A Question of Sport S52
programme.desc: Host Paddy McGuinness and team captains Sam Quek and Ugo Monye are joined by Premier League winner Jens Lehmann, legendary British gymnast Beth Tweddle, seven-time snooker world champion Stephen Hendry and BBC sports presenter JJ Chalmers.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You? S16
programme.desc: Rob Brydon and team captains Lee Mack and David Mitchell are joined by guests Chizzy Akudolu, Simon Gregson, Michelle Visage and Henning Wehn. They all reveal extraordinary stories about themselves, but are they telling the truth or making it all up?

programme.title: Have I Got News for You S65
programme.desc: Naga Munchetty is guest host, with panellists including Baroness Ruth Davidson joining team captains Paul Merton and Ian Hislop as they delve into the news.

programme.title: Black Ops S1 (5/6)
programme.desc: Following a lead, Dom and Kay set about investigating Riverford Residential Home.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international news, with reports from BBC correspondents worldwide.

programme.title: The Chris & Rosie Ramsey Show S2
programme.desc: Filmed in front of a live studio audience, the always up-for-a-laugh, always startlingly honest husband and wife presenting duo will be joined by another celebrity couple to poke fun at life, relationships, annoyances, parenting and absolutely everything in between. As well as sharing their relationship highs and, let's face it, most importantly, their 'beefs'. Other popular elements include Please Keep Me Anonymous where a well-known face reads out some terrifying audience confessions and It Goes Or I Go, where audience members compete to rid themselves of something their loved one just refuses to remove from the house.

programme.title: Bump (Feliz Día de la Madre!) S3 (n°5)
programme.desc: «Feliz Día de la Madre!»Unwanted Mother's Day surprises all round.

programme.title: Bump (Can't We Just Have a Few Nice Things) S3 (n°6)
programme.desc: «Can't We Just Have a Few Nice Things»Oly is hiding from her problems.
